revised_title: Approximate Solutions of Transient and Two-Dimensional Flame Phenomena
tldr: The authors present approximate methods for predicting transient and two-dimensional flame phenomena, focusing on constant-enthalpy flames. They adapt the 'profile' methods of boundary-layer theory to study various flame scenarios, such as contact of semi-infinite burnt and unburnt gas masses, contact with an adiabatic catalyst, and immersion of finite slabs in large gas masses. The methods provide accurate results and are relevant to steady-state flames as well.
